remarks: A composition law for class substitution.  Importantly, ` x ` may occur free in the class expression substituted for ` A ` .  (Contributed by NM, 5-Sep-2004.)  (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 8-Jun-2011.)
statement:
sbcco2.1 $e |- ( x = y -> A = B ) $.
sbcco2 $p |- ( [. x / y ]. [. B / x ]. ph <-> [. A / x ]. ph ) $.
$d A y $.
$d ph y $.
$d x y $.
